metadata.title: Xsun Buffer Overflow via HOME Envvar
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in Xsun in Solaris 8 and earlier allows local users to execute arbitrary commands via a long HOME environmental variable.

criterion.comment: X Window System platform software (SUNWxwplt) installed

metadata.title: RedHat Code Execution and DoS Vulnerabilities in PWLib
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities in PWLib before 1.6.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code, as demonstrated by the NISCC/OUSPG PROTOS test suite for the H.225 protocol.

modified.comment: Added a program_name element to rlt-217
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.
Updated inetlisteningservers_objects to match Schematron rules. Set the local_port entities to be datatype, 'int'.

criterion.comment: a program is listening on TCP or UDP port 1720

metadata.title: Red Hat netpbm File Overwrite Vulnerability
metadata.description: netpbm 9.25 and earlier does not properly create temporary files, which allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat XFree86 Buffer Overflow in ReadFontAlias
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in ReadFontAlias from dirfile.c of XFree86 4.1.0 through 4.3.0 allows local users and remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a font alias file (font.alias) with a long token, a different vulnerability than CVE-2004-0084 and CVE-2004-0106.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat XFree86 Buffer Overflow in ReadFontAlias II
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the ReadFontAlias function in XFree86 4.1.0 to 4.3.0, when using the CopyISOLatin1Lowered function, allows local or remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary code via a malformed entry in the font alias (font.alias) file, a different vulnerability than CVE-2004-0083 and CVE-2004-0106.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: XFree86 Font File Handling Vulnerability
metadata.description: Multiple unknown vulnerabilities in XFree86 4.1.0 to 4.3.0, related to improper handling of font files, a different set of vulnerabilities than CVE-2004-0083 and CVE-2004-0084.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise 3 netpbm File Overwrite Vulnerability
metadata.description: netpbm 9.25 and earlier does not properly create temporary files, which allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Mutt BO in Index Menu
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the index menu code (menu_pad_string of menu.c) for Mutt 1.4.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via certain mail messages.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Mailman Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability
metadata.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the admin CGI script for Mailman before 2.1.4 allows remote attackers to steal session cookies and conduct unauthorized activities.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.
Updated inetlisteningservers_objects to match Schematron rules. Set the local_port entities to be datatype, 'int'.

criterion.comment: httpd is listening on the network

metadata.title: Mailman Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability II
metadata.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the create CGI script for Mailman before 2.1.3 allows remote attackers to steal cookies of other users.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.
Updated inetlisteningservers_objects to match Schematron rules. Set the local_port entities to be datatype, 'int'.

criterion.comment: httpd is listening on the network

metadata.title: Gaim / Ultramagnetic BO Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Multiple buffer overflows in Gaim 0.75 and earlier, and Ultramagnetic before 0.81, allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via (1) cookies in a Yahoo web connection, (2) a long name parameter in the Yahoo login web page, (3) a long value parameter in the Yahoo login page, (4) a YMSG packet, (5) the URL parser, and (6) HTTP proxy connect.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Gaim / Ultramagnetic Extract Info Field Function BO
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the Extract Info Field Function for (1) MSN and (2) YMSG protocol handlers in Gaim 0.74 and earlier, and Ultramagnetic before 0.81, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Gaim / Ultramagnetic directIM Packet Vulnerability
metadata.description: Integer overflow in Gaim 0.74 and earlier, and Ultramagnetic before 0.81, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via a directIM packet that triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: slocate Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
metadata.description: Heap-based buffer overflow in main.c of slocate 2.6, and possibly other versions, may allow local users to gain privileges via a modified slocate database that causes a negative "pathlen" value to be used.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Midnight Commander vfs_s_resolve_symlink BO
metadata.description: Stack-based buffer overflow in vfs_s_resolve_symlink of vfs/direntry.c for Midnight Commander (mc) 4.6.0 and earlier, and possibly later versions, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code during symlink conversion.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Konqueror Cookie Access Restrictions Bypass Vulnerability
metadata.description: Konqueror in KDE 3.1.3 and earlier (kdelibs) allows remote attackers to bypass intended cookie access restrictions on a web application via "%2e%2e" (encoded dot dot) directory traversal sequences in a URL, which causes Konqueror to send the cookie outside the specified URL subsets, e.g. to a vulnerable application that runs on the same server as the target application.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise 3 Linux Kernel do_mremap Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
metadata.description: The do_mremap function for the mremap system call in Linux 2.2 to 2.2.25, 2.4 to 2.4.24, and 2.6 to 2.6.2, does not properly check the return value from the do_munmap function when the maximum number of VMA descriptors is exceeded, which allows local users to gain root privileges, a different vulnerability than CAN-2003-0985.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: RedHat Enterprise 3 Code Execution and DoS Vulnerabilities in PWLib
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities in PWLib before 1.6.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code, as demonstrated by the NISCC/OUSPG PROTOS test suite for the H.225 protocol.

Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Samba mksmboasswd Disabled Account Creation Vulnerability
metadata.description: The mksmbpasswd shell script (mksmbpasswd.sh) in Samba 3.0.0 and 3.0.1, when creating an account but marking it as disabled, may overwrite the user password with an uninitialized buffer, which could enable the account with a more easily guessable password.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.
Updated inetlisteningservers_objects to match Schematron rules. Set the local_port entities to be datatype, 'int'.

criterion.comment: smbd is listening on the network

metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in mod_python 3.0.x before 3.0.4, and 2.7.x before 2.7.9, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (httpd crash) via a certain query string.

metadata.title: Vicam USB Driver Data Copy Vulnerability
metadata.description: The Vicam USB driver in Linux before 2.4.25 does not use the copy_from_user function when copying data from userspace to kernel space, which crosses security boundaries and allows local users to cause a denial of service.

metadata.title: Red Hat tcpdump Denial of Service via ISAKMP Packets
metadata.description: tcpdump before 3.8.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via certain ISAKMP packets, a different vulnerability than CVE-2004-0057.

metadata.title: Red Hat sysstat port and trigger Scripts symlink Attack Vulnerability
metadata.description: The (1) post and (2) trigger scripts in sysstat 4.0.7 and earlier allow local users to overwrite arbitrary files via symlink attacks on temporary files, a different vulnerability than CVE-2004-0108.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat tcpdump Denial of Service via print_attr_string Function
metadata.description: The print_attr_string function in print-radius.c for tcpdump 3.8.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via a RADIUS attribute with a large length value.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat tcpdump Denial of Service via ISAKMP Packets II
metadata.description: The rawprint function in the ISAKMP decoding routines (print-isakmp.c) for tcpdump 3.8.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via malformed ISAKMP packets that cause invalid "len" or "loc" values to be used in a loop, a different vulnerability than CVE-2003-0989.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: RHE3 tcpdump DoS via ISAKMP Packets
metadata.description: tcpdump before 3.8.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via certain ISAKMP packets, a different vulnerability than CVE-2004-0057.

metadata.title: Red Hat CVS Server root Directory Access Vulnerability
metadata.description: CVS server before 1.11.10 may allow attackers to cause the CVS server to create directories and files in the file system root directory via malformed module requests.

metadata.title: Ethereal Malformed SMB Packet Vulnerability
metadata.description: The SMB dissector in Ethereal before 0.10.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service via a malformed SMB packet that triggers a segmentation fault during processing of Selected packets.

Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Ethereal Malformed Q.931 Packet Vulnerability
metadata.description: The Q.931 dissector in Ethereal before 0.10.0, and Tethereal, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a malformed Q.931, which triggers a null dereference.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat kdepim VCF File Information Reader BO
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the VCF file information reader for KDE Personal Information Management (kdepim) suite in KDE 3.1.0 through 3.1.4 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via a VCF file.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Kernel Real Time Clock Data Leakage
metadata.description: Real time clock (RTC) routines in Linux kernel 2.4.23 and earlier do not properly initialize their structures, which could leak kernel data to user space.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Linux Kernel do_mremap Denial of Service Vulnerability
metadata.description: The mremap system call (do_mremap) in Linux kernel 2.4.x before 2.4.21, and possibly other versions before 2.4.24, does not properly perform bounds checks, which allows local users to cause a denial of service and possibly gain privileges by causing a remapping of a virtual memory area (VMA) to create a zero length VMA, a different vulnerability than CAN-2004-0077.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: rpc.mountd Denial of Service via NFS Mount
metadata.description: rpc.mountd in nfs-utils after 1.0.3 and before 1.0.6 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via an NFS mount of a directory from a client whose reverse DNS lookup name is different from the forward lookup name.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.

metadata.title: Red Hat Multiple stack-based BO Vulnerabilities in Apache
metadata.description: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in (1) mod_alias and (2) mod_rewrite for Apache before 1.3.29 allow attackers to create configuration files to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via a regular expression with more than 9 captures.

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise 3 OpenSSL do_change_cipher_spec Function Denial of Service
metadata.description: The do_change_cipher_spec function in OpenSSL 0.9.6c to 0.9.6k, and 0.9.7a to 0.9.7c, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted SSL/TLS handshake that triggers a null dereference.

Corrected pattern used in rrt-206
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise 3 OpenSSL Improper Unknown Message Handling Vulnerability
metadata.description: OpenSSL 0.9.6 before 0.9.6d does not properly handle unknown message types, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop), as demonstrated using the Codenomicon TLS Test Tool.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected pattern used in rrt-206
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat S/MIME Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities in multiple vendor implementations of the Secure/Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (S/MIME) protocol allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via an S/MIME email message containing certain unexpected ASN.1 constructs, as demonstrated using the NISSC test suite.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Mozilla Bypass Cookie Access Restrictions Vulnerability
metadata.description: Mozilla allows remote attackers to bypass intended cookie access restrictions on a web application via "%2e%2e" (encoded dot dot) directory traversal sequences in a URL, which causes Mozilla to send the cookie outside the specified URL subsets, e.g. to a vulnerable application that runs on the same server as the target application.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Mozilla Zombie Document Vulnerability
metadata.description: Mozilla before 1.4.2 executes Javascript events in the context of a new page while it is being loaded, allowing it to interact with the previous page (zombie document) and enable cross-domain and cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, as demonstrated using onmousemove events.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the (1) nanohttp or (2) nanoftp modules in XMLSoft Libxml 2 (Libxml2) 2.6.0 through 2.6.5 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long URL.

metadata.title: Apache 2 Denial of Service due to Memory Leak in mod_ssl
metadata.description: Memory leak in ssl_engine_io.c for mod_ssl in Apache 2 before 2.0.49 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via plain HTTP requests to the SSL port of an SSL-enabled server.

metadata.title: Red Hat Squid ACL Bypass Vulnerability
metadata.description: The "%xx" URL decoding function in Squid 2.5STABLE4 and earlier allows remote attackers to bypass url_regex ACLs via a URL with a NULL ("%00") characterm, which causes Squid to use only a portion of the requested URL when comparing it against the access control lists.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.
Updated inetlisteningservers_objects to match Schematron rules. Set the local_port entities to be datatype, 'int'.

metadata.title: Multiple BO Vulnerabilities in Red Hat Ethereal
metadata.description: Multiple buffer overflows in Ethereal 0.8.13 to 0.10.2 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via the (1) NetFlow, (2) IGAP, (3) EIGRP, (4) PGM, (5) IrDA, (6) BGP, (7) ISUP, or (8) TCAP dissectors.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Ethereal Denial of Service via Malformed RADIUS Packet
metadata.description: The dissect_attribute_value_pairs function in packet-radius.c for Ethereal 0.8.13 to 0.10.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a malformed RADIUS packet that triggers a null dereference.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Ethereal Denial of Service via 0-Length Presentation Protocol Selector
metadata.description: Ethereal 0.10.1 to 0.10.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a zero-length Presentation protocol selector.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Multiple BO Vulnerabilities in Red Hat Enterprise 3 Ethereal
metadata.description: Multiple buffer overflows in Ethereal 0.8.13 to 0.10.2 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via the (1) NetFlow, (2) IGAP, (3) EIGRP, (4) PGM, (5) IrDA, (6) BGP, (7) ISUP, or (8) TCAP dissectors.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected pattern used in rrt-206
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise 3 Ethereal Denial of Service via Malformed RADIUS Packet
metadata.description: The dissect_attribute_value_pairs function in packet-radius.c for Ethereal 0.8.13 to 0.10.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a malformed RADIUS packet that triggers a null dereference.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected pattern used in rrt-206
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat OpenSSL Improper Unknown Message Handling Vulnerability
metadata.description: OpenSSL 0.9.6 before 0.9.6d does not properly handle unknown message types, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop), as demonstrated using the Codenomicon TLS Test Tool.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise 3 Ethereal Denial of Service via 0-Length Presentation Protocol Selector
metadata.description: Ethereal 0.10.1 to 0.10.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a zero-length Presentation protocol selector.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected pattern used in rrt-206
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise 3 S/MIME Protocol Denial of Service Vulnerability
metadata.description: Multiple vulnerabilities in multiple vendor implementations of the Secure/Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (S/MIME) protocol allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via an S/MIME email message containing certain unexpected ASN.1 constructs, as demonstrated using the NISSC test suite.

modified.comment: Corrected pattern used in rrt-206
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise 3 Mozilla Bypass Cookie Access Restrictions Vulnerability
metadata.description: Mozilla allows remote attackers to bypass intended cookie access restrictions on a web application via "%2e%2e" (encoded dot dot) directory traversal sequences in a URL, which causes Mozilla to send the cookie outside the specified URL subsets, e.g. to a vulnerable application that runs on the same server as the target application.

modified.comment: Corrected pattern used in rrt-206
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise 3 OpenSSL Kerberos Handshake Vulnerability
metadata.description: The SSL/TLS handshaking code in OpenSSL 0.9.7a, 0.9.7b, and 0.9.7c, when using Kerberos ciphersuites, does not properly check the length of Kerberos tickets during a handshake, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted SSL/TLS handshake that causes an out-of-bounds read.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise 3 Mozilla Zombie Document Vulnerability
metadata.description: Mozilla before 1.4.2 executes Javascript events in the context of a new page while it is being loaded, allowing it to interact with the previous page (zombie document) and enable cross-domain and cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks, as demonstrated using onmousemove events.

modified.comment: Corrected pattern used in rrt-206
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Linux Kernel ip_setsockopt Integer Overflow
metadata.description: Integer overflow in the ip_setsockopt function in Linux kernel 2.4.22 through 2.4.25 and 2.6.1 through 2.6.3 allows local users to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via the MCAST_MSFILTER socket option.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Linux Kernel ISO9660 File System Component BO
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the ISO9660 file system component for Linux kernel 2.4.x, 2.5.x and 2.6.x, allows local users with physical access to overflow kernel memory and execute arbitrary code via a malformed CD containing a long symbolic link entry.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise 3 Squid ACL Bypass Vulnerability
metadata.description: The "%xx" URL decoding function in Squid 2.5STABLE4 and earlier allows remote attackers to bypass url_regex ACLs via a URL with a NULL ("%00") characterm, which causes Squid to use only a portion of the requested URL when comparing it against the access control lists.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.
Updated inetlisteningservers_objects to match Schematron rules. Set the local_port entities to be datatype, 'int'.

criterion.comment: squid is listening on the network

metadata.title: Racoon IKE Daemon Unauthorized X.509 Certificate Connection Vulnerability
metadata.description: The KAME IKE Daemon Racoon, when authenticating a peer during Phase 1, validates the X.509 certificate but does not verify the RSA signature authentication, which allows remote attackers to establish unauthorized IP connections or conduct man-in-the-middle attacks using a valid, trusted X.509 certificate.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.
Updated inetlisteningservers_objects to match Schematron rules. Set the local_port entities to be datatype, 'int'.

criterion.comment: racoon is listening on the network

metadata.title: KAME IKE Daemon Improper Hash Value Handling
metadata.description: KAME IKE daemon (racoon) does not properly handle hash values, which allows remote attackers to delete certificates via (1) a certain delete message that is not properly handled in isakmp.c or isakmp_inf.c, or (2) a certain INITIAL-CONTACT message that is not properly handled in isakmp_inf.c.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.
Updated inetlisteningservers_objects to match Schematron rules. Set the local_port entities to be datatype, 'int'.

criterion.comment: racoon is listening on the network

metadata.title: Konqueror URI Handler "-" Filter Vulnerability
metadata.description: The URI handlers in Konqueror for KDE 3.2.2 and earlier do not properly filter "-" characters that begin a hostname in a (1) telnet, (2) rlogin, (3) ssh, or (4) mailto URI, which allows remote attackers to manipulate the options that are passed to the associated programs, possibly to read arbitrary files or execute arbitrary code.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

criteria.comment: telnet, rlogin, ssh or kmail is executable

metadata.title: rsync Path Sanitation Vulnerability
metadata.description: rsync before 2.6.1 does not properly sanitize paths when running a read/write daemon without using chroot, which allows remote attackers to write files outside of the module's path.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: CVS pserver BO
metadata.description: Heap-based buffer overflow in CVS 1.11.x up to 1.11.15, and 1.12.x up to 1.12.7, when using the pserver mechanism allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via Entry lines.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: libpng Malformed PNG Image Vulnerability
metadata.description: The Portable Network Graphics library (libpng) 1.0.15 and earlier allows attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a malformed PNG image file that triggers an error that causes an out-of-bounds read when creating the error message.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

criteria.comment: libpng/libpng-devel is less than 1.2.2-21 or libpng10/libpng-devel less than 1.0.13 is installed

metadata.title: tcpdump Delete Payload in ISAKMP Packets Vulnerability
metadata.description: TCPDUMP 3.8.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via ISAKMP packets containing a Delete payload with a large number of SPI's, which causes an out-of-bounds read, as demonstrated by the Striker ISAKMP Protocol Test Suite.

metadata.title: Red Hat OpenSSL do_change_cipher_spec Function Denial of Service
metadata.description: The do_change_cipher_spec function in OpenSSL 0.9.6c to 0.9.6k, and 0.9.7a to 0.9.7c, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted SSL/TLS handshake that triggers a null dereference.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: tcpdump Identification Payload in ISAKMP Packets Vulnerability
metadata.description: Integer underflow in the isakmp_id_print for TCPDUMP 3.8.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via an ISAKMP packet with an Identification payload with a length that becomes less than 8 during byte order conversion, which causes an out-of-bounds read, as demonstrated by the Striker ISAKMP Protocol Test Suite.

metadata.title: Multiple BO Vulnerabilities in LHA get_header Function
metadata.description: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the get_header function in header.c for LHA 1.14, as used in products such as Barracuda Spam Firewall, allow remote attackers or local users to execute arbitrary code via long directory or file names in an LHA archive, which triggers the overflow when testing or extracting the archive.

metadata.title: Multiple Directory Traversal Vulnerabilities in LHA
metadata.description: Multiple directory traversal vulnerabilities in LHA 1.14 allow remote attackers or local users to create arbitrary files via an LHA archive containing filenames with (1) .. sequences or (2) absolute pathnames with double leading slashes ("//absolute/path").

metadata.title: Utempter Directory Traversal Vulnerability
metadata.description: Utempter allows device names that contain .. (dot dot) directory traversal sequences, which allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on device names in combination with an application that trusts the utmp or wtmp files.

metadata.title: NTLM Authentication BO in Squid Web Proxy Cache
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the ntlm_check_auth (NTLM authentication) function for Squid Web Proxy Cache 2.5.x and 3.x, when compiled with NTLM handlers enabled, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a long password ("pass" variable).

modified.comment: Corrected the local_port entity for a linux-def:inetlisteningservers_object. Local_port was given a datatype of 'int'.

criterion.comment: squid is listening on the network

metadata.title: Ethereal Denial of Service via SIP Messages
metadata.description: Ethereal 0.10.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via certain SIP messages between Hotsip servers and clients.

metadata.title: Racoon Denial of Service via Large Length Field
metadata.description: Racoon before 20040408a allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via an ISAKMP packet with a large length field.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.
Updated inetlisteningservers_objects to match Schematron rules. Set the local_port entities to be datatype, 'int'.

criterion.comment: racoon is listening on the network

metadata.title: Ethereal AIM Dissector Vulnerability
metadata.description: The AIM dissector in Ethereal 0.10.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assert error) via unknown attack vectors.

metadata.title: Ethereal SPNEGO Dissector Vulnerability
metadata.description: The SPNEGO dissector in Ethereal 0.9.8 to 0.10.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via unknown attack vectors that cause a null pointer dereference.

metadata.title: Ethereal MMSE Dissector Vulnerability
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the MMSE dissector for Ethereal 0.10.1 to 0.10.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: Multiple BO Vulnerabilities in MIT Kerberos 5
metadata.description: Multiple buffer overflows in krb5_aname_to_localname for MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.3.3 and earlier allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code as root.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:def:991 - Typo Corrections

criterion.comment: krb5-libs rpm version prior to 1.2.7-24 is installed

metadata.title: CVS Improper Handling of Malformed Entry Lines
metadata.description: CVS 1.12.x through 1.12.8, and 1.11.x through 1.11.16, does not properly handle malformed "Entry" lines, which prevents a NULL terminator from being used and may lead to a denial of service (crash), modification of critical program data, or arbitrary code execution.

criterion.comment: cvs rpm version prior to 1.11.2-24 is installed

metadata.title: CVS error_prog_name Double-free Vulnerability
metadata.description: Double free vulnerability for the error_prog_name string in CVS 1.12.x through 1.12.8, and 1.11.x through 1.11.16, may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

criterion.comment: cvs rpm version prior to 1.11.2-24 is installed

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 3 Kernel Serial Link Information Disclosure Vulnerability
metadata.description: /proc/tty/driver/serial in Linux 2.4.x reveals the exact number of characters used in serial links, which could allow local users to obtain potentially sensitive information such as the length of passwords.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.
EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:obj:927 - Removed unneeded negate="false" and added "xsi:nil='true'" to filenames to indicate directory is the file object, not the files in the directory.

metadata.title: Integer overflow in the "Max-dotdot" CVS protocol command
metadata.description: Integer overflow in the "Max-dotdot" CVS protocol command (serve_max_dotdot) for CVS 1.12.x through 1.12.8, and 1.11.x through 1.11.16, may allow remote attackers to cause a server crash, which could cause temporary data to remain undeleted and consume disk space.

criterion.comment: cvs rpm version prior to 1.11.2-24 is installed

metadata.title: CVS serve_notify Improper Handling of Empty Data Lines
metadata.description: serve_notify in CVS 1.12.x through 1.12.8, and 1.11.x through 1.11.16, does not properly handle empty data lines, which may allow remote attackers to perform an "out-of-bounds" write for a single byte to execute arbitrary code or modify critical program data.

criterion.comment: cvs rpm version prior to 1.11.2-24 is installed

metadata.title: SquirrelMail Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability I
metadata.description: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in SquirrelMail 1.4.2 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary script as other users and possibly steal authentication information via multiple attack vectors, including the mailbox parameter in compose.php.

modified.comment: Updated inetlisteningservers_objects to match Schematron rules. Set the local_port entities to be datatype, 'int'.

criterion.comment: squirrelmail rpm version prior to 1.4.3-0.e3.1 is installed
httpd is listening on the network

metadata.title: SquirrelMail Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability II
metadata.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in mime.php for SquirrelMail before 1.4.3 allows remote attackers to insert arbitrary HTML and script via the content-type mail header, as demonstrated using read_body.php.

modified.comment: Updated inetlisteningservers_objects to match Schematron rules. Set the local_port entities to be datatype, 'int'.

criterion.comment: squirrelmail rpm version prior to 1.4.3-0.e3.1 is installed
httpd is listening on the network

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise 3 Kernel Real Time Clock Data Leakage
metadata.description: Real time clock (RTC) routines in Linux kernel 2.4.23 and earlier do not properly initialize their structures, which could leak kernel data to user space.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise 3 Kernel R128 DRI Limits Checking Vulnerability
metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in Linux kernel before 2.4.22 allows local users to gain privileges, related to "R128 DRI limits checking."

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: SquirrelMail SQL Injection Vulnerability
metadata.description: SQL injection vulnerability in SquirrelMail before 1.4.3 RC1 allows remote attackers to execute unauthorized SQL statements, with unknown impact, probably via abook_database.php.

modified.comment: Updated inetlisteningservers_objects to match Schematron rules. Set the local_port entities to be datatype, 'int'.

criterion.comment: squirrelmail rpm version prior to 1.4.3-0.e3.1 is installed
httpd is listening on the network

metadata.title: Red Hat Enterprise 3 Kernel ncp_lookup Function BO
metadata.description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the ncp_lookup function for ncpfs in Linux kernel 2.4.x allows local users to gain privileges.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Malicious CVS Server RCS diff File Vulnerability in CVS Client
metadata.description: The client for CVS before 1.11 allows a remote malicious CVS server to create arbitrary files using certain RCS diff files that use absolute pathnames during checkouts or updates, a different vulnerability than CVE-2004-0405.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Red Hat OpenSSL Kerberos Handshake Vulnerability
metadata.description: The SSL/TLS handshaking code in OpenSSL 0.9.7a, 0.9.7b, and 0.9.7c, when using Kerberos ciphersuites, does not properly check the length of Kerberos tickets during a handshake, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted SSL/TLS handshake that causes an out-of-bounds read.

modified.comment: Corrected syntax errors in sql verion of the definition.
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Directory Traversal Vulnerability in CVS Server
metadata.description: CVS before 1.11 allows CVS clients to read arbitrary files via .. (dot dot) sequences in filenames via CVS client requests, a different vulnerability than CVE-2004-0180.

modified.comment: Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Multiple Format String Vulnerabilities in neon and Dependent Products
metadata.description: Multiple format string vulnerabilities in (1) neon 0.24.4 and earlier, and other products that use neon including (2) Cadaver, (3) Subversion, and (4) OpenOffice, allow remote malicious WebDAV servers to execute arbitrary code.

modified.comment: modified upt-36 - Fixed typo: oofice should have been ooffice
modified upt-37 - Fixed typo--oofice should have been ooffice
modified upt-38 - Fixed typo--oofice should have been ooffice
modified cmp-940 - Fixed comment typo--oofice should have been ooffice
Corrected regex to match only reasonable values for machine class. Implemented by Jon Baker of the MITRE Corporation.

metadata.title: Solaris 9 CDE ToolTalk Database Null Write Vulnerability
metadata.description: CDE ToolTalk database server (ttdbserver) allows remote attackers to overwrite arbitrary memory locations with a zero, and possibly gain privileges, via a file descriptor argument in an AUTH_UNIX procedure call, which is used as a table index by the _TT_ISCLOSE procedure.

modified.comment: modified sat-6 - Changed test to pattern match and added check for 64bit version
modified sat-6 - Changed regular expression test to properly check for 64bit package
fixed the service_name entity used in the inetd_object
Fixed incorrect user_id element value in process_state. Incorrect value was 'root', updated to value of '0'.

metadata.title: Solaris SAdmin Client Credentials Remote Administrative Access Vulnerability
metadata.description: The default installation of sadmind on Solaris uses weak authentication (AUTH_SYS), which allows local and remote attackers to spoof Solstice AdminSuite clients and gain root privileges via a certain sequence of RPC packets.

modified.comment: Added check for sadmind called with strong authentication
Corrected datatype on version element of patch state. Datatype must be int.
fixed the service_name entity used in the inetd_object
fixed the service_name entity used in the inetd_object
Fixed incorrect user_id element value in process_state. Incorrect value was 'root', updated to value of '0'.

criterion.comment: System and Network Administration Framework Installed

metadata.title: FreeRADIUS Ascend-Send-Secret Server Crash
metadata.description: FreeRADIUS before 1.0.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (server crash) by sending an Ascend-Send-Secret attribute without the required leading packet.

modified.comment: Updated inetlisteningservers_objects to match Schematron rules. Set the local_port entities to be datatype, 'int'.

criterion.comment: radiusd is listening on the network

metadata.title: Solaris CDE DTLogin XDMCP Parser Remote Double Free Vulnerability
metadata.description: Double free vulnerability in dtlogin in CDE on Solaris, HP-UX, and other operating systems allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted XDMCP packet.

modified.comment: Added patch 107180-31 test for Solaris 7. Changed vulnerable software test logic a little
Corrected datatype on base element. Datatype must be int.
Corrected datatype on version element in ste:841. Datatype must be int.

metadata.title: Integer Overflow in libpng via Malformed PNG Image
metadata.description: Multiple integer overflows in the (1) png_read_png in pngread.c or (2) png_handle_sPLT functions in pngrutil.c or (3) progressive display image reading capability in libpng 1.2.5 and earlier allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a malformed PNG image.

metadata.title: ypbind Daemon Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in ypbind daemon in Solaris 5.4 through 8 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: Apache Connection Blocking Denial Of Service Vulnerability
metadata.description: Apache 1.4.x before 1.3.30, and 2.0.x before 2.0.49, when using multiple listening sockets on certain platforms, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (blocked new connections) via a "short-lived connection on a rarely-accessed listening socket."

modified.comment: Changed apache test to file test
Changed apache test to package test

metadata.title: Multiple Buffer Overflows in Kerberos 5 (krb5_aname_to_localname)
metadata.description: Multiple buffer overflows in krb5_aname_to_localname for MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.3.3 and earlier allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code as root.

modified.comment: Changed two unknown tests for kerberos configuration to Solaris text file contents tests
Added negate=true attribute to criteria sub-block to fix conversion error from OVAL 4.2 to OVAL 5.0

criterion.comment: /etc/krb5/krb5.conf is configured with a kerberos domain
/etc/krb5/krb5.conf is configured with explicit or rules-based mapping

metadata.title: ISC BIND Cache Poison Denial Of Service
metadata.description: ISC BIND 8.3.x before 8.3.7, and 8.4.x before 8.4.3, allows remote attackers to poison the cache via a malicious name server that returns negative responses with a large TTL (time-to-live) value.

modified.comment: modified sat-10 - Changed test to pattern match to check for 64bit version of Core Solaris
modified sat-10 - Changed regular expression to properly check for 64bit package

metadata.title: System V login Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in login in various System V based operating systems allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via a large number of arguments through services such as telnet and rlogin.

metadata.title: Kerberos Client Plaintext Password Vulnerability
metadata.description: Solaris 9, when configured as a Kerberos client with patch 112908-12 or 115168-03 and using pam_krb5 as an "auth" module with the debug feature enabled, records passwords in plaintext, which could allow local users to gain other user's passwords by reading log files.

modified.comment: Changed all unknown tests to solaris file contents tests

criterion.comment: /etc/pam.conf is configured to use pam_krb5 as an 'auth' module and the debug feature of pam_krb5 is enabled
/etc/krb5/krb5.conf is configured with a kerberos domain
/etc/syslog.conf is configured to log "debug" level messages for at least daemon

metadata.title: Kerberos 5 ASN.1 Library DoS
metadata.description: The asn1buf_skiptail function in the ASN.1 decoder library for MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.2.2 through 1.3.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a certain BER encoding.

modified.comment: Changed kerberos unknown test to solaris file contents test

criterion.comment: /etc/krb5/krb5.conf is configured with a kerberos domain

metadata.title: Samba call_trans2open() Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in the call_trans2open function in trans2.c for Samba 2.2.x before 2.2.8a, 2.0.10 and earlier 2.0.x versions, and Samba-TNG before 0.3.2, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

modified.comment: Fixed incorrect user_id element value in process_state. Incorrect value was 'root', updated to value of '0'.

criteria.comment: Inetd running and inetd.conf contains smbd

metadata.title: Sendmail Custom DNS Map Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Buffer overflow in Sendmail before 8.12.5, when configured to use a custom DNS map to query TXT records, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code via a malicious DNS server.

modified.comment: Removed "Sendmail running" configuration test. Sendmail installs as SUID root

metadata.title: Multiple Buffer Overflows in libpng
metadata.description: Multiple buffer overflows in libpng 1.2.5 and earlier, as used in multiple products, allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via malformed PNG images in which (1) the png_handle_tRNS function does not properly validate the length of transparency chunk (tRNS) data, or the (2) png_handle_sBIT or (3) png_handle_hIST functions do not perform sufficient bounds checking.

metadata.title: BSM Audit Kernel Panic
metadata.description: Unknown vulnerability in the Basic Security Module (BSM), when configured to audit either the Administrative (ad) or the System-Wide Administration (as) audit class in Solaris 7, 8, and 9, allows local users to cause a denial of service (kernel panic).

modified.comment: Operation changed from not equal to equals for object oval:org.mitre.oval:obj:458.

criterion.comment: Auditing Administrative or System-Wide Administrative audit classes

metadata.title: DoS Vulnerability in libpng function png_handle_iCCP()
metadata.description: The png_handle_iCCP function in libpng 1.2.5 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a certain PNG image that triggers a null dereference.

metadata.title: OpenSSL Double-free Vulnerability
metadata.description: Double free vulnerability in OpenSSL 0.9.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via an SSL client certificate with a certain invalid ASN.1 encoding.

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:obj:434 - In some "pattern match" strings added "\" before "." to clarify if "point" or "any symbol" needed.

criterion.comment: Apache running with SunPlex Manager config

metadata.title: OpenSSL Denial of Service Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: The do_change_cipher_spec function in OpenSSL 0.9.6c to 0.9.6k, and 0.9.7a to 0.9.7c, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted SSL/TLS handshake that triggers a null dereference.

metadata.title: Data Leak in NIC
metadata.description: Multiple ethernet Network Interface Card (NIC) device drivers do not pad frames with null bytes, which allows remote attackers to obtain information from previous packets or kernel memory by using malformed packets, as demonstrated by Etherleak.

modified.comment: Fixed obj:424: set operation to pattern match on filename. Removed pattern match from path.

criterion.comment: Lance Ethernet (le) interface configured to start

metadata.title: Buffer Management Error in OpenSSH
metadata.description: A "buffer management error" in buffer_append_space of buffer.c for OpenSSH before 3.7 may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by causing an incorrect amount of memory to be freed and corrupting the heap, a different vulnerability than CVE-2003-0695.

metadata.title: Solaris 9 CDE ToolTalk Database Server Symbolic Link Vulnerability
metadata.description: CDE ToolTalk database server (ttdbserver) allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the transaction log file used by the _TT_TRANSACTION RPC procedure.

modified.comment: modified sat-6 - Changed test to pattern match and added check for 64bit version
modified sat-6 - Changed regular expression test to properly check for 64bit package
fixed the service_name entity used in the inetd_object
Fixed incorrect user_id element value in process_state. Incorrect value was 'root', updated to value of '0'.

metadata.title: Denial of Service Vulnerability in Linux Kernel do_fork Function via CLONE_VM
metadata.description: The do_fork function in Linux 2.4.x before 2.4.26, and 2.6.x before 2.6.6, does not properly decrement the mm_count counter when an error occurs after the mm_struct for a child process has been activated, which triggers a memory leak that allows local users to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion) via the clone (CLONE_VM) system call.

criteria.comment: kernel, kernel-hugemem or kernel-smp rpm older than 2.4.21-15.0.2EL Epoch 0

metadata.title: Linux Kernel Denial of Service Vulnerability via fsave and frstor Instructions
metadata.description: Linux kernel 2.4.x and 2.6.x for x86 allows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash), possibly via an infinite loop that triggers a signal handler with a certain sequence of fsave and frstor instructions, as originally demonstrated using a "crash.c" program.

criteria.comment: kernel, kernel-hugemem or kernel-smp rpm older than 2.4.21-15.0.2EL Epoch 0

metadata.title: Multiple Privilege Escalation Vulnerabilities in Linux Kernel
metadata.description: Multiple unknown vulnerabilities in Linux kernel 2.4 and 2.6 allow local users to gain privileges or access kernel memory, as found by the Sparse source code checking tool.

criteria.comment: kernel, kernel-hugemem or kernel-smp rpm older than 2.4.21-15.0.2EL Epoch 0

metadata.title: Sendmail prescan function Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: The prescan function in Sendmail 8.12.9 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via buffer overflow attacks, as demonstrated using the parseaddr function in parseaddr.c.

metadata.title: Kerberos 5 Double-free Vulnerability in krb5_rd_cred Function
metadata.description: Double free vulnerability in the krb5_rd_cred function for MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.3.1 and earlier may allow local users to execute arbitrary code.

modified.comment: Changed kerberos unknown test to solaris file contents test

criterion.comment: /etc/krb5/krb5.conf is configured with a kerberos domain

metadata.title: Runtime linker, ld.so.1 LD_PRELOAD Envvar Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Stack-based buffer overflow in the runtime linker, ld.so.1, on Solaris 2.6 through 9 allows local users to gain root privileges via a long LD_PRELOAD environment variable.

criteria.comment: Solaris 9 OR Patch 106950-14+ OR Patch 109147-07+ installed

metadata.title: Sendmail Ruleset Parsing Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: A "potential buffer overflow in ruleset parsing" for Sendmail 8.12.9, when using the nonstandard rulesets (1) recipient (2), final, or (3) mailer-specific envelope recipients, has unknown consequences.

criterion.comment: Sendmail has recipient or final rulesets

metadata.title: Portable Network Graphics Library Offset Calculation Vulnerability
metadata.description: Portable Network Graphics (PNG) library libpng 1.2.5 and earlier does not correctly calculate offsets, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a buffer overflow attack on the row buffers.

criteria.comment: libpng or libpng-devel rpm older than 1.2.2-24, Epoch 2 OR libpng10or libpng10-devel rpm older than 1.0.13-14, Epoch 0

metadata.title: Apache Web Server Multiple Module Local Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in (1) mod_alias and (2) mod_rewrite for Apache before 1.3.29 allow attackers to create configuration files to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via a regular expression with more than 9 captures.

metadata.title: DtMail Local Command Line Format String Vulnerability
metadata.description: Format string vulnerability in CDE Mailer (dtmail) on Solaris 8 and 9 allows local users to gain privileges via format strings in the argv[0] value.

metadata.title: Apache Error Log Escape Sequence Injection Vulnerability
metadata.description: Apache does not filter terminal escape sequences from its error logs, which could make it easier for attackers to insert those sequences into terminal emulators containing vulnerabilities related to escape sequences.

modified.comment: Change apache test to file test
Changed apache test to package test

metadata.title: OpenSSL Integer Overflow Vulnerability
metadata.description: Integer overflow in OpenSSL 0.9.6 and 0.9.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via an SSL client certificate with certain ASN.1 tag values.

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:obj:434 - In some "pattern match" strings added "\" before "." to clarify if "point" or "any symbol" needed.

criterion.comment: Apache running with SunPlex Manager config

metadata.title: Apache mod_digest Nonce Verification Vulnerability
metadata.description: mod_digest for Apache before 1.3.31 does not properly verify the nonce of a client response by using a AuthNonce secret.

modified.comment: Change apache test to file test
Changed apache test to package test

metadata.title: OpenSSL ASN.1 Inputs Character Tracking Vulnerability
metadata.description: OpenSSL 0.9.6 and 0.9.7 does not properly track the number of characters in certain ASN.1 inputs, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via an SSL client certificate that causes OpenSSL to read past the end of a buffer when the long form is used.

modified.comment: EDITED oval:org.mitre.oval:obj:434 - In some "pattern match" strings added "\" before "." to clarify if "point" or "any symbol" needed.

criterion.comment: Apache running with SunPlex Manager config

metadata.title: MIT Kerberos 5 Multiple Double-Free Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Double free vulnerabilities in error handling code in krb524d for MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.2.8 and earlier may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

metadata.title: Apache Mod_Access Access Control Rule Bypass Vulnerability
metadata.description: mod_access in Apache 1.3 before 1.3.30, when running big-endian 64-bit platforms, does not properly parse Allow/Deny rules using IP addresses without a netmask, which could allow remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions.

modified.comment: Changes apache test to file test
Changed apache test to package test

metadata.title: Apache Mod_Proxy Remote Negative Content-Length Buffer Overflow
metadata.description: Heap-based buffer overflow in proxy_util.c for mod_proxy in Apache 1.3.25 to 1.3.31 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (process crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a negative Content-Length HTTP header field, which causes a large amount of data to be copied.

modified.comment: Changed apache test to file test
Changed apache test to package test

metadata.title: Kerberos 5 KDC ASN.1 Error Handling Double-free Vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Double free vulnerabilities in the error handling code for ASN.1 decoders in the (1) Key Distribution Center (KDC) library and (2) client library for MIT Kerberos 5 (krb5) 1.3.4 and earlier may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

modified.comment: Changed kerberos unknown test to solaris file contents test

criterion.comment: /etc/krb5/krb5.conf is configured with a kerberos domain

unknown_test.comment: Sendmail has recipient or final rulesets

notes.note: egrep "^[Srecipient=2|S2]|^[^#]*\$>2|^[^#]*\$>recipient|^[^#]*\$>4|^[^#]*\$>final" /etc/mail/sendmail.cf True if any lines returned

process_test.comment: Apache running with SunPlex Manager config

unknown_test.comment: Auditing Administrative or System-Wide Administrative audit classes

notes.note: egrep ^flags:.*a[sd] /etc/security/audit_control True if any lines returned
grep c2audit /etc/system True if "set c2audit:audit_load = 1" or similiar
